Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal was dominant as the Tigers took game two in Cleveland, 3-0.
Kerry Carpenter hit a rare hanging slider from Emmanuel Clase into the Progressive Field seats in right field.
Jose Ramirez went hitless with two strikeouts.
The lefty masher lineup rolled out by manager Stephen Vogt could not solve Skubal for seven innings.
Will Vest and Beau Briske successfully pitched in relief for the Tigers.
Matthew Boyd and the Guardians bullpen performed well until Clase entered to close out the 8th inning.
Steven Kwan made a crucial play with his glove to help close out the 8th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The article mentioned the importance of not letting Riley Greene and Kerry Carpenter beat the Guardians.
Post-Match Reflections: The author expressed concern about Emmanuel Clase's performance in colder weather.
The author noted that the Guardians will need more from their lineup to win future games.
The author reflected on the well-played game against two very good teams and the unpredictable nature of baseball playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals beat the Yankees, tying every division series at 1-1.
